result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Louis Sarckees was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC ( 2nd/subsequent offense dismissed) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Louis Sarckees

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Defendant Michael Louis Sarckees in court with attorney Frank J. Parise.  Defendant Michael Louis Sarckees in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Plea questionnaire filed.  
State's offer and recommendation:  Plea to count 1 as amended, dismiss/read-in count 2; recommend time served.
Court colloquy re rights being waived, elements of crime and possible penalties.
State consents to jury waiver.
PLEA - guilty
Finding and judgment of guilt.  Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.
Sentencing argument
BTC:  time serve, $400 + court costs, DNA sample.  60 days to pay.
For Defendant to come from Kenosha County Detention Center to court on 1-30-15 at 10:00 AM.

Defendant Michael Louis Sarckees in court with attorney Frank J. Parise.  Defendant Michael Louis Sarckees in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Resolution reached; contemplates amendment to misdemeanor.  Plea/sentencing requested.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
For defendant to come from Kenosha to court on 12-15-2014.
Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 14, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Michael Louis Sarckees in court with attorney Frank J. Parise.  Defendant Michael Louis Sarckees in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendant.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael Louis Sarckees in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Michael Louis Sarckees in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
